fr.upmc.components.registry

Class GlobalRegistry

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.upmc.components.registry.GlobalRegistry

  • public class GlobalRegistry
extends java.lang.Object
    The class GlobalRegistry implements the global registry for the component model that registers connection information to remotely access components through their ports.

    Description

    The Registry implements a global registry for the component model allowing to bind port URI to information required for the connection between components through ports. The registry must be run on one host which name is given in the static variable REGISTRY_HOSTNAME. It listens to request on a port which number is given by the static variable REGISTRY_PORT Protocol (spaces are used to split the strings, so they are meaningful): 
     Requests              Responses
 
 lookup           ok 
                       nok
 put       ok
                       nok bound!
 remove           ok
                       nok not_bound!
 shutdown              ok
        nok unkonwn_command!
    When the static variable DEBUG is set to true, the registry provides with a log on STDOUT of the commands it executes.

    Invariant

     invariant      true

    Created on : 2012-10-22

    Version:
    $Name$ -- $Revision$ -- $Date$
    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      protected static class  GlobalRegistry.ProcessLookup
      The class ProcessLookup implements a runnable task used to look up the registry for a given key.
      protected static class  GlobalRegistry.ProcessPut
      The class ProcessPut implements a runnable task used to update the registry with the association of a given key to a given value.
      protected static class  GlobalRegistry.ProcessRemove
      The class ProcessRemove implements a runnable task used to remove the association of a given key from the registry.
      protected static class  GlobalRegistry.ServiceRunnable
      The class ServiceRunnable implements the behaviour of the registry exchanging with one client; its processes the requests from the clients until the latter explicitly disconnects with a "shutdown" request of implicitly with a null string request.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected ConfigurationParameters configurationParameters
      Configuration parameters from the configuration file.
      static boolean DEBUG0
      If true, an echo of some commands executed is provided on STDOUT.
      static boolean DEBUG1
      If true, a log of the commands executed is provided on STDOUT.
      protected java.util.Hashtable<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> directory
      Directory of information, a hashtable with String keys and values.
      protected java.util.concurrent.CountDownLatch finished
      synchroniser to finish the execution of this global registry.
      protected static int MAX_NUMBER_OF_THREADS 
      protected int numberOfJVMsInDCVM
      Number of JVM in the current distributed component virtual machine.
      static java.lang.String REGISTRY_HOSTNAME
      Default name of the host running the registry; is configurable.
      static int REGISTRY_PORT
      Registry port number listen for commands; is configurable.
      protected static java.util.concurrent.ExecutorService REQUEST_HANDLER
      The executor service in charge of handling component requests.
      protected java.net.ServerSocket ss
      The server socket used to listen on the port number REGISTRY_PORT.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GlobalRegistry(java.lang.String configFileName)
      create a registry object, using the configuration file to know the number of clients that will connect, and therefore that will have to disconnect for the registry to terminate its execution.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
      initialise and run the registry.
      void run()
      runs the registry, repeated accepting connections on its server socket, decoding the request (in the format defined by the above protocol), executing it and returning the result (in the format defined by the above protocol) on the output stream of the socket.
